metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17545 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GDAL through 3.0.1 has a poolDestroy double free in OGRExpatRealloc in ogr/ogr_expat.cpp when the 10MB threshold is exceeded. It was discovered that GDAL incorrectly handled memory allocation. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gdal-bin - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
libgdal-java - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
libgdal-perl - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
libgdal1h - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
python-gdal - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
python3-gdal - 1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gdal package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.10.1+dfsg-5ubuntu1+esm1').
